intro: Brachysema acuminatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, featuring slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive corona. Brachysema acuminatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along streambanks.
